The **Glasgow Outcome Scale - Extended** (GOS-E) is commonly used to measure TBI outcome:

1. Death
2. Vegetative state\
Unaware, periods of spontaneous eye opening, persistent reflex responses.
3. Lower severe disability\
Dependent, unable to be left alone for >8 hours.
4. Upper severe disability\
Dependent, able to be left alone for >8 hours.
5. Lower moderate disability\
Independent at home, dependent outside, unable to return to work.
6. Upper moderate disability\
Independent at home, dependent outside, able to return to work with special arrangement.
7. Lower good recovery\
Some disability but able to return to work.
8. Upper good recovery\
Some deficits but not disabling.
